globalMetadata.title: Good Thinking - NHS approved wellbeing service
globalMetadata.description: Anxious, stressed, depressed or having trouble sleeping? Find NHS-approved mental health tools and advice to support you.

attributes.alternativeText: Group of friends sitting on grass in front of London skyline
attributes.name: OG Image.png

links.text: Find the right help for you

footer.description: Good Thinking provides a range of resources to help Londoners improve their mental wellbeing.

subscribeFooterText.copy: Get the latest tips and resources for Londoners delivered to your inbox every month.

partners.name: Transformation Partners in Health and Care

howToUseSection.bodyText:
Find support, advice and resources by:

  • Mental health concern

Sleep, Anxiety, Low mood, Stress.

  • Audience

Young people, Employers and employees, Someone who is grieving, Faith and belief communities.

  • Type of support

Self-assessments, free apps, podcasts, videos, how to guides, workbooks.

Get expert advice from Good Thinking

The Good Thinking team has created a broad range of advice in collaboration with clinical and subject-area experts, designed to support Londoners with everyday mental health challenges.

In our Latest Advice section, you'll find short guides with tips and resource recommendations to help you with a range of concerns including dealing with uncertainty, money worries, getting enough sleep and coping with bereavement. 

If you’re looking for advice on a specific subject, type in your topic in the ‘search﻿’ box at the top of the page.

howToUseSection.bodyText:
Use the Good Thinking self-assessment tool

Our in-depth, clinically validated self-assessments are a thorough assessment of both your mental and physical wellbeing. They may seem quite ‘medical’ because they are based on the types of questions a doctor or a psychologist might ask you.

  • Each self-assessment takes around 20 minutes to complete
  • Answer questions about yourself or someone you may be concerned about
  • You’ll get a personalised list of recommended actions to take forward

howToUseSection.tabText: Find the right help for you
howToUseSection.bodyText:
Find the right help for you

Tell us what you're looking for help with and who you're looking for help for and you’ll then receive personalised recommendations for apps and other resources to meet your needs.

pageData.title: Podcasts, videos, webinars and training
pageData.subtitle: Insights and personal stories from experts and from people who know how you are feeling because they’ve been there. They are a great way to understand more about what can help. On this page, you'll also find links to informative webinars and training sessions you can take on mental health and wellbeing. Check them out now!

tabs.title: Podcasts
tabs.content:
Community wellbeing

  • Life in the LGBTQ+ community (Andrew Keates)
  • Muslim Youth Helpline (Maaria Mahmood & Hadil Nour)
  • Making positive changes where you live (Tracey Robbins)
  • Connecting with nature for better mental health (The Eden Project)
  • Supporting those with Eating Disorders (BEAT)
  • Mental health from a male perspective (Antonio Ferreira)
  • Juggling priorities: how to manage supporting the whole family (Paula Ludley, co-founder of the Nine Day Week)

Digital wellbeing

  • Mental health in online communities (Darren Gough, Expert in Community Management and Founder of Island23)
  • Online communities for support (Annie Mullins OBE, Independent Online Safety Expert)
  • Online safety for young people (Catherine McAllister, Head of Editorial Standards at BBC Children’s Department)
  • Feeling Good App (Dr Alastair Dobbin)
  • Supporting a healthy screen/life balance (Tanya Goodin, Digital Wellbeing Expert)

Financial wellbeing

  • Mental health and debt - Christians Against Poverty (CAP)

Health inequalities and inclusion

  • Breaking down barriers to accessing mental health services (Yolanda Agyemang-Baah, Brent Medical Practice)
  • Understanding Digital Inclusion and Digital Inequalities with Professor Ellen Helsper

Workplace wellbeing

  • How to make your business successful (Jo Franco-Wheeler, Director of Organisational Development and Diversity at Inmarsat)
  • The permanent working from home arrangement (Nicola Millard, Principal Innovation Partner, BT)
  • The challenges of a dispersed workforce (Kathryn Davies, Head of Learning, Procter & Gamble)

Young people and student wellbeing

  • Building self-awareness and resilience for better mental wellbeing (Digital Health Ambassadors, Partnership for Young London)
  • Starting at University (Theoni Fernando, Partnership for Young London and Grace Etheridge, The Student Room)
  • Black students and mental health (a collection of podcasts from the LSBU and Office for Students Black Students Mental Health Project)
  • Want to stop bullying behaviour? It starts with the dictionary… (Alex Holmes and Will Poulter)

General mental wellbeing

  • Benefits of healthy sleep patterns (Michael Farquhar, Consultant in Paediatric Sleep Medicine, Guy's & St Thomas' NHS Trust)
  • Why a micropause can help your mental health today (Janet Wingrove, Mindfulness Trainer and Consultant Psychologist, SLaM)
  • Shout – the crisis text line (Victoria Hornby, CEO at Mental Health Innovations)
  • Retaining hope (Steven Oliver, retired bishop and former BBC chief producer)
  • A public health response to a pandemic (Professor Kevin Fenton, Regional Director for Public Health in London, Public Health England)

tabs.title: Videos
tabs.content:
• The Salam Project
  • Joanne shares the four steps that have helped her mental health
  • Cllr Caroline Stock, the importance of looking after your mental health and wellbeing
  • Laurie Rackind, Chief Executive at Jami, on connecting with other people
  • Rabbi Daniel Epstein of Western Marble Arch Synagogue, on being physically active
  • Rabbi Miriam Berger, Finchley Reform Synagogue on learning something new every day
  • Emma Dorman, Senior Education Coordinator at Jami, on giving to others
  • Philippa Carr, Education Manager at Jami , on paying attention to the present moment

• Good Thinking's guide to looking out for those around you

  • The Good Thinking Guide to Mental Health Apps - Feeling Good
  • The Good Thinking Guide to Mental Health Apps - Stem4
  • An Introduction to the Good Thinking ‘Coping with Trauma Workbook’
  • Digital Inclusion Workshop I - Should everyone go online?
  • Digital Inclusion Workshop II - Can you achieve good health if just offline?
  • Digital Inclusion Workshop III - Are Digital Skills key to better health?
  • Digital Inclusion Workshop IV - Is NHS Digital transformation good for all?
